prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you card for such a great time in California. Make it fun and exciting, colourful, California palm trees and beach, sun"
Style: ðŸŽ­ Pop Art
Tone: ðŸ˜„ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: Akanksha & Ronny
From: Swasti
Message: "Dear Akanksha & Ronny,

Thank you for the amazing California adventure! I'm pretty sure my body is now 50% sunshine, 50% amazing food, and 100% missing you both. You're the best tour guides and hosts I  could ask for!

Can't wait for our next trip,
Swasti"

Reference: "Cute cartoon retain details"

CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details





- Create cartoon/illustrated characters inspired by reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions

Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. I have included my own reference image. Create a stylized cartoon/illustrated character inspired by the reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions of real people, instead create charming cartoon-style characters with simplified, friendly features. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Dear Akanksha & Ronny,

Thank you for the amazing California adventure! I'm pretty sure my body is now 50% sunshine, 50% amazing food, and 100% missing you both. You're the best tour guides and hosts I  could ask for!

Can't wait for our next trip,
Swasti" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio, in a vibrant Pop Art style reminiscent of Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, featuring bold, saturated colors and comic book aesthetics with halftone dot patterns. The scene depicts a fun and exciting California beach experience. In the foreground, three stylized cartoon characters with simplified, friendly features are in a bright pink convertible car, all wearing colorful sunglasses and smiling broadly. The character on the left has blonde hair and is waving, wearing a red polka-dot top and red sunglasses. The middle character has black hair, wearing yellow sunglasses and a yellow top. The character on the right, presumably the driver, has brown hair and wears blue sunglasses and a yellow shirt. The background shows a bright turquoise ocean with a yellow sun (with halftone dots) in a clear sky. Several stylized palm trees with bright pink fronds are scattered across the scene, adding to the California vibe. At the top, a stylized white speech bubble contains the text \"Thank you!\" in a bold, black, handwritten cursive script, with a slight shadow effect. The overall mood is humorous, lighthearted, and energetic, capturing a memorable adventure.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio, in a consistent Pop Art style with bold colors and halftone dots, creating a simple yet innovative decorative design that provides a peaceful closure. The design subtly references elements from the front cover, featuring stylized pink palm fronds and a hint of the turquoise ocean or sky pattern. The focus is on a serene, unexpected artistic motif, possibly an abstract representation of sunshine or waves using bold color blocks and graphic linework, rather than typical patterns. The bottom-right corner (approximately 1 inch square) is left completely clear for a QR code. Decorative elements are concentrated towards the center and left side, maintaining a minimalist and artistic feel that complements the overall card's theme and tone without any text or people. The mood is subtly creative and quietly beautiful.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio, continuing the vibrant Pop Art style with bold colors and halftone dots. This panel offers complete creative freedom, designed as an artistic playground for a humorous and lighthearted tone. It could feature abstract, brightly colored shapes that evoke sunshine, waves, or a road trip, interwoven with playful patterns inspired by California motifs like stylized surfboards or retro car elements, all rendered in the signature Pop Art aesthetic. No people are depicted. The composition is dynamic and unexpected, using bold color blocking and graphic linework to create a visually engaging and memorable experience that harmonizes with the overall card's artistic universe.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio, showcasing the climax of the visual story in a vibrant Pop Art style with bold colors and halftone dots. The central area, safely distanced from edges, features the message \"Dear Akanksha & Ronny, Thank you for the amazing California adventure! I'm pretty sure my body is now 50% sunshine, 50% amazing food, and 100% missing you both. You're the best tour guides and hosts I could ask for! Can't wait for our next trip, Swasti\" written in a beautiful, clearly readable, elegant handwritten cursive script with a nice pen-style appearance, natural ink flow, and slight line weight variations. This handwritten text is integrated into innovative and unexpected decorative artwork that frames it, moving beyond typical florals. The artwork uses bold color palettes and graphic elements reminiscent of the front cover, possibly abstract representations of Californian elements like stylized sunshine rays, abstract waves, or bold color patterns that evoke the excitement of the trip, all rendered in the Pop Art style. The overall mood is heartfelt and visually engaging, creating an emotional peak for the card experience."
}
```

```json
{
  "frontCover": "Pop art style greeting card front cover (9:16 ratio) with a bright yellow background featuring a subtle, small, dark yellow halftone dot pattern. Centered in the frame are a pair of stylized blue sunglasses with thick black outlines. The overall tone is fun, exciting, and colorful, embodying the California theme with a humorous, lighthearted feel. \"Thank you\" text in a clear, legible, flowing cursive script is positioned safely in the central area, adhering to the 10% edge safe zone.",

The design is minimalistic and serene, providing a peaceful closure to the visual story. In the center-left, a single, stylized palm tree silhouette in black is depicted against a soft pink circular backdrop. The bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) is left completely clear and undecorated to reserve space for a QR code. The overall style is Pop Art, echoing the bold colors and graphic aesthetic of the front cover, but with a more subdued and elegant execution.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior spread for a greeting card (9:16 ratio), rendered in a vibrant Pop Art style with a bright yellow background and a subtle, small, dark yellow halftone dot pattern. The design is entirely abstract and decorative, with no people or characters. Bold, geometric shapes in contrasting colors like turquoise, pink, and black are arranged dynamically across the spread, creating a sense of playful energy and excitement. Interspersed are scattered, small, stylized palm leaf motifs and subtle wave-like patterns. The color palette is consistent with the front cover, maintaining a cohesive visual narrative. The design focuses on visual storytelling and artistic expression, avoiding generic patterns.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior spread for a greeting card (9:16 ratio), in a vibrant Pop Art style with a bright yellow background and a subtle, small, dark yellow halftone dot pattern. The central area of the spread, positioned safely within the 10% edge zone, features the handwritten message: \"Dear Akanksha & Ronny, Thank you for the amazing California adventure! I'm pretty sure my body is now 50% sunshine, 50% amazing food, and 100% missing you both. You're the best tour guides and hosts I could ask for! Can't wait for our next trip, Swasti\". The handwriting is in an elegant, legible, flowing cursive script with natural ink flow variations. This message is intricately framed by bold, abstract Pop Art elements, including dynamic lines and shapes in turquoise and pink, and scattered palm tree silhouettes. The overall design is innovative and artistic, creating a visually stimulating backdrop for the heartfelt message while maintaining the fun, exciting, and colorful California theme."
}
```
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card, rendered in a vibrant Pop Art style reminiscent of Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein. The composition is divided into four distinct panels against a full-bleed background. The top left panel features a stylized, bright turquoise taco with a purple interior, outlined in thick black, set against a vibrant red background with a sparse pattern of small, bright yellow dots. Adjacent to it, in the top right panel, is a sliced avocado, depicted in bright pink with a deep magenta pit, against a bright turquoise background with a similar yellow dot pattern. The bottom left panel showcases a classic hamburger with an orange bun, green lettuce, and yellow cheese, outlined in black, against a hot pink background with a dense pattern of small, bright yellow dots. The bottom right panel contains a blue and pink swirled soft-serve ice cream cone, also outlined in black, against a bright yellow background with a dense pattern of small, bright pink dots. All panels feature bold, saturated colors and thick black outlines, with the characteristic halftone dot pattern adding texture and depth, creating a dynamic and visually engaging spread that evokes a playful and humorous tone.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a vibrant Pop Art style. The background features a stylized, large yellow sun with bold orange sunbeams radiating outwards against a bright yellow sky, rendered with Ben-Day dots. Below this, stylized fluffy white clouds with black outlines and subtle stippling are positioned. The lower half of the card depicts a dynamic ocean scene with turquoise water and bold, graphic waves with white crests, also outlined in black and featuring stippling. A cream-colored rectangular panel, slightly offset from the center, serves as the prominent message area. Inside this panel, the message "Dear Akanksha & Ronny, Thank you for the amazing California adventure! I'm pretty sure my body is now 50% sunshine, 50% amazing food, and 100% missing you both. You're the best tour guides and hosts I could ask for! Can't wait for our next trip, Swasti" is written in a charming, legible, flowing cursive script with a slight handwritten pen appearance. The overall aesthetic is cheerful, bright, and embodies the fun, exciting, and colorful California beach theme. Style: Pop Art with bold colors, comic book elements, and graphic design aesthetics.
